**Live demonstration of building a reproducibility package with AI assistance**

## Example 1: Summary

To do all this, we used:

::: incremental
-   Integrated Development Environment (IDE) - [Positron](https://positron.posit.co/){target="_blank"}

-   [GitHub Copilot](https://github.com/features/copilot){target="_blank"} that used Anthropic [Claude Sonnet 4.5 LLM](https://claude.com/) to provide:

    -   [Inline code completions](https://positron.posit.co/assistant-completions.html){target="_blank"}
    -   [Chat: help and assistance](https://positron.posit.co/assistant-chat.html){target="_blank"}
    -   [Agent: active changes to my code and code execution](https://positron.posit.co/assistant-chat-agents.html){target="_blank"}

:::

## How does this different from a familiar AI-chat?

-   **AI-Agent**: AI acted autonomously, execute code, changed files, etc.

-   **Context aware**: AI understood files, data, and code structures.

-   **IDE**: AI was **integrated** into our **development environment**, worked **alongside us**.

-   **Privacy**: AI **did NOT have access to our data**.

    -   All code was executed locally, AI has only seen the output structure.

## AI: Chat | Agent | Inline Code


:::::: columns
:::: {.column width="30%" .fragment}

**AI-Chat**

-   General assistance
-   Limited context: only what you tell it
-   Code snippets
-   Explanations of code/output

::: callout-tip
Use to **Ask** the model to think and reason.
:::

::::

:::: {.column width="40%" .fragment}


**AI-Agent**

-   Execute Mode
-   Context awareness
-   Integrated with development
-   Writes and runs after user's approval
-   End‑to‑end tasks (clean → estimate → table → robustness)

::: callout-tip
Use **Agent** mode to execute explicit instructions.
:::
::::

:::: {.column width="30%" .fragment}

**Inline Code Completion**

-   Real-time code suggestions while you type

::: callout-tip
Use for quick code snippets.
:::

::::
::::::

---

## Context Awareness

::::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
**What AI "knows":**

-   **Files**: Code, docs, structure
-   **Data structure**: Variable names, types
-   **History**: Edits, commands
-   **Environment**: Packages, dependencies
-   **Intent**: Current task
-   **Execution results**: Output, errors
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
**Why it matters:**

-   Project-specific suggestions
-   Understands dependencies
-   Reduces hallucinations

:::
:::::

::: footer
**See:** [Positron: AI Context](https://positron.posit.co/assistant-chat-context.html){target="_blank"}, or [GHCopilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot#understanding-copilot-context){target="_blank"}, and [Claude](https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-sonnet-4-5){target="_blank"}
:::

## Model Context Protocol (MCP)

::::: columns
::: {.column width="15%"}
![](images/mcp-logo.png){width="100"}
:::

::: {.column width="85%"}
::: {.callout-note appearance="simple"}
"A universal adapter for AI: one standard protocol replacing fragmented data integrations, connecting assistants to any system where information lives."— [Anthropic's invention](https://www.anthropic.com/news/model-context-protocol){target="_blank"}
:::
:::


:::::
::: fragment

There is a [growing ecosystem of MCPs](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers){target="_blank"} .

:::

::::: columns
::: {.column width="75%" .fragment}
**MCP are essential to connect LLMs with:**

-   Execution environments: **Stata**, R, Python
-   Editors: Positron, VS Code, RStudio, JupyterLab
-   Data sources: databases, APIs, files
-   Tools: version control (GitHub), visualization, reporting
:::

::: {.column width="25%" .fragment}
Relevant are:

- [Stata-MCP extension](https://github.com/sepinetam/stata-mcp){target="_blank"}
- [R MCP Tools](https://tidyverse.org/blog/2025/07/mcptools-0-1-0/){target="_blank"}

:::
:::::

## Integrated Development Environments (IDEs)

**Your all-in-one workspace for data analysis:**

::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Popular IDEs:**

-   **Positron** (Posit) - Modern AI-native IDE
-   **RStudio** - R-focused environment
-   **JupyterLab** - Notebook-based interface
-   **VS Code** - General-purpose with extensions
-   **Claude Code** - Anthropic's AI coding IDE
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**What IDEs provide:**

-   **Code editor** with syntax highlighting
-   **Console/terminal** for interactive execution
-   **File browser** and project management
-   **Variable/data viewer** to inspect objects
-   **Plot viewer** for visualizations
-   **Integrated AI assistants** (Chat, Agent, Completions)
:::
:::::

::: fragment
**Why use an IDE?** Everything in one place: write code, run analysis, view results, get AI help—no context switching between applications.
:::


## LLMs for Coding

**Large Language Models powering AI assistants:**

::: incremental
-   **GitHub Copilot**: Uses OpenAI models (GPT-4) and Anthropic Claude
-   **OpenAI GPT**: GPT-4, GPT-4 Turbo
-   **Anthropic Claude**: Opus, Sonnet, Haiku
-   **Others**: Google Gemini, Meta Llama, Mistral
:::

. . .

::: callout-note
## Software Development vs Data Analysis

While these tools were built for software development, they excel at data analysis tasks: data cleaning, statistical modeling, visualization, and report generation.
:::
